name: ESLint Config Generator for UI Projects
description: A comprehensive ESLint configuration generator for UI projects supporting React, Vue, Angular, and Svelte. Includes accessibility linting, TypeScript support, Prettier integration, and best practices for modern web development.

aiAgentInstructions.summary: Generate an ESLint configuration file tailored to the user's project framework and requirements. Detect the existing project structure, package.json dependencies, and TypeScript usage to provide the most appropriate ESLint setup. Include accessibility linting rules and Prettier integration when appropriate. CRITICAL: Always detect installed ESLint version to determine correct config format - ESLint v9+ requires flat config (eslint.config.js), older versions use legacy format (.eslintrc.js).
keyFeatures: Framework-specific ESLint configurations (React, Vue, Angular, Svelte)
Best practices and code quality rules
Automatic ESLint version detection for proper config format
Support for both flat config (v9+) and legacy config formats
Auto-detection of project framework and TypeScript usage
implementationSteps: 1. CRITICAL FIRST STEP: Check installed ESLint version in package.json or by running 'npx eslint --version' to determine config format
2. Detect the project's framework by examining package.json dependencies (react, vue, @angular/core, svelte)
3. Detect TypeScript usage by checking for typescript dependency and tsconfig.json
4. Detect Prettier by checking for prettier dependency or .prettierrc file
5. IMPORTANT: Based on ESLint version, choose config format: ESLint v9+ = eslint.config.js (flat config, REQUIRED), ESLint v8 or earlier = .eslintrc.js (legacy config)
6. Generate the base ESLint configuration with appropriate parser and plugins using the CORRECT format for the detected version
8. Add TypeScript-specific rules if TypeScript is detected
9. Add accessibility plugins (jsx-a11y for React, vuejs-accessibility for Vue)
10. Configure Prettier integration if Prettier is detected
12. For flat config (v9+): integrate ignore patterns into eslint.config.js. For legacy config: create separate .eslintignore file
13. Add npm scripts to package.json for linting (lint, lint:fix)
14. Provide installation instructions for required dependencies
15. Generate example usage and configuration documentation with version notes

toolingSpec.goal: Generate production-ready ESLint configuration files tailored to the project's framework, TypeScript usage, and ESLint version. Ensure accessibility linting, import organization, and code quality best practices are included. CRITICAL: Always detect ESLint version first - v9+ requires flat config (eslint.config.js), v8 and earlier use legacy config (.eslintrc.js).

frameworkDetection.description: Detect the project's JavaScript framework to apply appropriate ESLint plugins and rules
methods: Examine package.json dependencies for framework indicators
Check for framework-specific config files (tsconfig.json, vite.config.js, etc.)
Look for framework imports in main entry files

typescriptDetection.description: Detect TypeScript usage to add appropriate parser and rules
indicators: tsconfig.json file exists in project root

prettierDetection.description: Detect Prettier to avoid ESLint formatting conflicts
prettierDetection.configurationNote: Add 'prettier' as LAST item in extends array to disable conflicting ESLint formatting rules

commonRules.description: Best practice rules applicable to all JavaScript/TypeScript projects

importOrderRules.description: Enforce consistent import organization across the project

accessibilityRules.description: Accessibility linting rules for framework-specific components

typescriptRules.description: TypeScript-specific rules when TypeScript is detected

workflow: 1. Detect ESLint version (npx eslint --version or check package.json)
2. Determine config format based on version (v9+ = flat config, v8 or earlier = legacy)
3. Detect project framework (React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, or vanilla)
4. Detect TypeScript usage (check for typescript in package.json or tsconfig.json)
5. Detect Prettier (check for prettier in package.json or .prettierrc)
6. Generate appropriate config file (eslint.config.js for v9+, .eslintrc.js for v8 or earlier)
8. Add TypeScript parser and rules if detected
9. Add accessibility linting plugins (jsx-a11y for React, vuejs-accessibility for Vue)
10. Add Prettier integration if detected (add 'prettier' as last extends item)
12. Configure ignore patterns (in config for v9+, separate .eslintignore for v8 or earlier)
13. Install all required dependencies (provide npm/yarn/pnpm commands)
14. Add npm scripts to package.json (lint, lint:fix)
15. Test configuration by running 'npm run lint'

v9Plus.note: Flat config is REQUIRED for ESLint v9+. Legacy .eslintrc.* files will not work.

v8AndEarlier.note: Consider upgrading to ESLint v9+ for modern flat config format.

securityConsiderations: ESLint runs code from node_modules during linting - ensure plugins are from trusted sources
Review .eslintignore patterns to avoid accidentally linting sensitive files (e.g., .env files)
Use --max-warnings flag in CI to enforce zero warnings for production code
Keep ESLint and plugins updated to get security fixes
Avoid disabling security-related rules (e.g., no-eval, no-implied-eval)
Review custom rules carefully before adding to configuration
Do not commit .eslintcache file to version control (contains file system paths)

versionDetection.critical: ALWAYS detect ESLint version before generating config to use correct format
detectionMethods: Check package.json devDependencies for eslint version (look for "eslint": "^9.0.0" or similar)
Run 'npx eslint --version' to get installed version
If no ESLint installed yet, install latest version (will be v9+)

v9.0.0+.ignorePatterns: Integrated into eslint.config.js using ignores array
v9.0.0+.note: Flat config is REQUIRED for ESLint v9+. Legacy .eslintrc.* files will not work and will produce an error.

v8.x.x and earlier.note: Legacy config format. Consider upgrading to ESLint v9+ for modern flat config.

errorMessages.missingFlatConfig: ESLint couldn't find an eslint.config.(js|mjs|cjs) file

githubActions.content:
name: Lint

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main, develop]

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '18'
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm run lint

wrongConfigFormat.problem: ESLint v9+ shows error: 'ESLint couldn't find an eslint.config.(js|mjs|cjs) file'
wrongConfigFormat.cause: ESLint v9+ requires flat config format, but legacy .eslintrc.* files exist
wrongConfigFormat.solution: Delete all .eslintrc.* and .eslintignore files, then create eslint.config.js with flat config format

eslintignoreDeprecated.problem: Warning: 'The .eslintignore file is no longer supported'
eslintignoreDeprecated.cause: ESLint v9+ integrates ignore patterns into the config file
eslintignoreDeprecated.solution: Move ignore patterns from .eslintignore to ignores array in eslint.config.js

parserConflicts.cause: Framework parsers need to be configured in specific order
parserConflicts.solution: Use framework parser as main parser, specify TypeScript parser in parserOptions

importResolution.cause: Import resolver not configured for TypeScript or framework-specific files
importResolution.solution: Configure import resolver in settings section

prettierConflicts.problem: ESLint formatting rules conflict with Prettier
prettierConflicts.cause: ESLint formatting rules enabled alongside Prettier
prettierConflicts.solution: Add eslint-config-prettier as LAST item in extends array

performanceSlow.problem: ESLint is running slowly on large projects
performanceSlow.cause: Linting too many files or complex rules
solutions: Add more ignore patterns (node_modules, dist, coverage)
Disable type-aware rules if not needed (@typescript-eslint/recommended-requiring-type-checking)
Run ESLint only on changed files in pre-commit hooks

testingChecklist: Verify ESLint version is detected correctly (run 'npx eslint --version')
Confirm correct config file is created (eslint.config.js for v9+, .eslintrc.js for v8 or earlier)
Check that framework is detected correctly from package.json dependencies
Verify TypeScript parser is added if TypeScript is detected (check for typescript in package.json)
Confirm accessibility plugins are included (jsx-a11y for React, vuejs-accessibility for Vue)
Test that ignore patterns work (run lint, verify node_modules/dist/build are ignored)
Run 'npm run lint' to verify configuration works without errors
Run 'npm run lint:fix' to test auto-fix functionality works
Check that import/export organization rules work (imports should be sorted alphabetically)
Verify no-console warnings appear but don't fail the build (warnings should show)
Test that unused variables trigger warnings (create test file with unused variable)
Confirm curly brace enforcement works (if without braces should error)
If Prettier is detected, verify no formatting conflicts exist (no prettier/prettier errors)
Test VS Code integration if ESLint extension is installed (auto-fix on save)
Verify linting works on all file types (.js, .jsx, .ts, .tsx, .vue, .svelte as applicable)
Confirm accessibility rules catch common a11y issues (test img without alt, button without text)
Test that ESLint catches common bugs (== instead of ===, var instead of const/let)
Verify max-depth and complexity warnings appear for deeply nested code
Check that TypeScript-specific rules work if TypeScript is detected (any type should warn)
Test CI/CD integration if applicable (GitHub Actions workflow runs successfully)
